translation: The jingling sound of bows appears like the sound of flowing stream.
And the steel-weapons have been struck in great anger, which appear unique and frightening.7.84.
The sound of drums rises in the battle and the warriors glisten their weapons.

gurmukhi: prI ku`t ku`tM lgy DIr D`ky ]
transliteration: Daroo Koutt Kouttan Lage Dhoor Dhakke||
translation: There is a great rush of blows and the men of endurance are experiencing shocks.
The vultures shriek and the clarionets are being played.
It appears that terrible tigers are roaring and roaming.8.85.
On the other side the demon warrior Rkat Beej was infuriated.

gurmukhi: pHwry BlI BwNq so Awn qIrM ]
transliteration: Prahdare Bhaloo Bhaant So Aan Tooran||
translation: He shot his arrows very dexterously.

gurmukhi: auqy daur dyvI krXo K`g pwqM ]
transliteration: Oute Daur Devoo Daryo Khagg Paatan||
translation: The goddess then speedily struck her sword.

gurmukhi: igirE mUrCw huAY BXo jwnu GwqM ]9]86]
translation: Which cused the demon to fall senseless, it seemed that he has passed away.9.86.
When he came to senses, the mighty hero roared.

gurmukhi: GrI cwr lau swr so swr b`jXo ]
transliteration: Gdaroo Chaar Lau Saar So Saar Bajjyo||
translation: For four gharis, the steel clasged with steel.

gurmukhi: lgy bwx sRoxM igirE BUim ju`DM ]
transliteration: Lage Baan Sronan Girio Bhoom(i) Juddhan||
translation: With the infliction of the arrow of the goddess, the blood of Rakat Beej began to fall on the ground.

gurmukhi: auTy bIr qyqy kIey nwd kRu`DM ]10]87]
transliteration: Outhe Boor Tete Kooe Naad Kruddhan||10||87||
translation: With innumerable drops of blood arose innumerable Rakat Beejas, who began to shout with rage.10.87
